title: Text face to partner with FB Griffith Gothic
content:
Any helpful designers want to chime in with a nice text face which would go well with Font Bureau’s Griffith Gothic? Samples here:  
 [http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/GriffithGothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006091419/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/GriffithGothic "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/GriffithGothic")

This is a history book “for dummies”, on the history of Israel, with a slightly more sophisticated bent than the actual “for dummies” book series. The application might carry over onto a companion website.

Thanks for your input

/\/\  
Meir Deutsch

 [‹ Grid systems](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006091419/http:/www.typophile.com/node/7401 "Go to previous forum topic") [Creating design briefs ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006091419/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37084 "Go to next forum topic")
author: meirdeutsch

comments.content:
Interesting timing, Marc Oxborrow [just posted](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006091419/http:/typophile.com/node/37180) a piece he lovely designed with Griffith and [Miller](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006091419/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Miller).

I also think [ITC Charter](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006091419/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/paratype/itc_charter_ot/) or [FF Clifford](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006091419/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_clifford/) would work well with Griffith, depending on how traditional you want the look.
